title: Charlie McAvoy apologizes for Team USA’s reaction to Trump joke about US women’s team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy apologized for Team USA's reaction to a joke by Donald Trump about the US women's hockey team.
Trump's comment, deemed 'distasteful' by US women's captain Hilary Knight, received laughter from the men's team.
US women's team, Olympic champions, declined Trump's White House invitation due to scheduling conflicts post-Games.

title: Mayor Jake Wilson plans to tackle Somerville’s housing crisis. Will it work?
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Somerville Mayor Jake Wilson prioritizes more density, new zoning, and increased investment in affordable housing to address the housing crisis.
Despite adding 2,046 units from 2020 to 2025, median home prices in Somerville rose 67% to $1.3 million by 2025.
Projects like 299 Broadway aim to increase affordable housing with 288 units, 132 affordable at 30% and 60% AMI.

title: Watch this wild (and inspirational) video out of New Bedford following the blizzard
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: New Bedford resident Scott Vicente drove his pickup truck through unplowed snow on Madeira Avenue and Earle Street.
Allie Crane captured a video of Vicente's truck navigating heavy snow, despite the risky driving conditions.
Vicente advised New Bedford drivers to avoid unplowed streets and stay home while the city clears snow.

title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Feb. 26, 2026)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: La Tavernetta by Chef Douglass Williams to open in East Boston in Spring 2026, offering coastal Italian cuisine.
Salt & Straw ice cream shop to open its second New England location in the Seaport area by late 2026.
Sorella Cucina Toscana now open in Burlington, serving Italian dishes such as lobster gnocchi and veal osso bucco.

title: Patriots still deciding what former defensive coordinator Terrell Williams’s role will be
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Terrell Williams remains with the New England Patriots but his specific role on Mike Vrabel's staff is undecided.
Williams missed part of last season due to prostate cancer; Zak Kuhr acted as interim defensive coordinator.
The Patriots appointed Kuhr as defensive coordinator after a successful season; Williams may help in various team roles.

title: ‘Jeopardy!’ contestants struggled with a Boston category. Can you beat them?
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Jeopardy!' contestants got 3 out of 5 correct in the 'Boston Space' category on February 23, 2026.
Contestants failed to answer two clues about Faneuil Hall and Back Bay, leading to 'triple stumpers'.
'Boston Space' category included questions on Bunker Hill Monument and the Freedom Trail, among others.

title: What we get wrong about sex, love, and monogamy
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Kinsey Institute director Justin Garcia discusses intimacy, 'slow love,' and monogamy on the Love Letters podcast.
Garcia differentiates between social and sexual monogamy, emphasizing the complexity of modern relationships.
Young people embrace 'slow love,' taking more time to form deeper connections before committing to marriage.

title: Tom Brady calls FIFA president ‘man of the people’ ahead of 2026 World Cup
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Tom Brady praised FIFA president Gianni Infantino as a 'man of the people', drawing mixed reactions ahead of the 2026 World Cup.
Local critics have expressed concerns over increased ticket costs and security funding for the tournament, affecting fans in Foxborough.
Infantino's leadership has faced scrutiny due to controversial decisions, including support for Russia's FIFA reinstatement and awarding Donald Trump a Peace Prize.

title: ‘We just do it’: Massachusetts plow drivers recount 24-hour shift during blizzard
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts plow drivers worked nonstop 24-hour shifts following the Feb. 23 blizzard that deposited up to 3 feet of snow.
Challenges included snow removal equipment repairs and ice melt shortages, impacting efforts in areas like Weymouth and South Boston.
Despite exhaustion, drivers expressed pride in community support and maintaining access for essential workers and residents.

title: 4 charged in alleged $7M pandemic relief fraud scheme
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Four individuals, including Lorne Johnson from Boston, charged in $7 million pandemic relief fraud scheme.
Defendants allegedly submitted fraudulent PPP applications and collected kickbacks, according to the U.S. Attorney's Office.
Jean-Jacques and Pierre face additional charges linked to mortgage loan and lease fraud schemes.
